title: BYD Seal
content:

The '''BYD Seal''' ({{zh|s=比亚迪海豹|t=|p=Bǐyǎdí Hǎibào|c=}}) is a [[battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[Mid-size car|mid-size]] [[sedan (automobile)#Fastback sedans|fastback sedan]] produced by [[BYD Auto]]. It is the second [[passenger car]] of BYD's "Ocean Series" after the smaller [[hatchback]] [[BYD Dolphin]].<ref name=":0">{{cite web|url=https://thedriven.io/2022/03/15/byd-seal-atto-4-electric-sportscar-to-rival-tesla-model-3-confirmed-for-australia/|title=BYD Seal electric sportscar to rival Tesla Model 3 confirmed for Australia|date=15 March 2022|last=Schmidt|first=Bridie|publisher=The Driven|accessdate=17 April 2022}}</ref> The Seal is built on the [[BYD Auto#e-Platform 3.0|e-Platform 3.0]] and BYD's new 800-volt electrical platform.<ref name="trive">{{Cite web |date=20 February 2022 |title=BYD planning Model-3-like 800-volt sedan called Seal |url=https://www.electrive.com/2022/02/20/byd-planning-model-3-like-800-volt-sedan-called-seal/ |access-date=29 March 2022 |website=electrive.com |language=en-US}}</ref> 

Three unrelated vehicles produced by BYD also uses the Seal nameplate. The [[BYD Seal DM-i|Seal DM-i]] is a larger sedan with [[plug-in hybrid]] powertrain, while the [[BYD Seal 06|Seal 06 DM-i]] is a similarly sized sedan with plug-in hybrid powertrain. The [[BYD Seal U|Seal U]] is a renamed BYD Song Plus for export markets.

==Overview==
The BYD Seal was announced in China in May 2022, with deliveries in August 2022. Its design was previewed as the BYD Ocean-X Concept in September 2021.<ref>{{Cite web |date=8 September 2021 |title=BYD LAUNCHES E-PLATFORM 3.0 WITH THE NEW CONCEPT CAR OCEAN-X|url=https://en.byd.com/news/byd-launches-e-platform-3-0-with-the-new-concept-car-ocean-x/|access-date=30 March 2022 |website=byd.com|language=en}}</ref> As part of the "Ocean Series" line of products, the Seal adopts many ocean-inspired design features. The exterior design features low hood, pop-out door handles, and long taillamp unit. The dashboard air vents of the Seal have a wavy pattern.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Bobylev |first=Denis |date=2022-05-20 |title=BYD Seal With 517 HP And 650 KM Range For 43,000 USD Launched In China |url=https://carnewschina.com/2022/05/20/byd-seal-with-517-hp-and-650-km-range-for-43000-usd-launched-in-china/ |access-date=2024-01-10 |website=CarNewsChina.com |language=en-US}}</ref>

The battery of the Seal is structural, giving the [[unibody]] chassis higher [[torsional rigidity]] (40,500 Nm/deg compared with an industry average of around 25,000) and a lower floor compared to other electric cars.<ref>{{Cite web |title=BYD Seal review – plus video twin test vs Tesla Model 3 |url=https://www.carmagazine.co.uk/car-reviews/byd/seal-ev/ |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=CAR Magazine |language=en}}</ref> The Seal has a [[drag coefficient]] of just 0.219 Cd. BYD claims a 50:50 [[weight distribution]] between the front and the rear for the Performance AWD variant.<ref name="CE">{{Cite web |last=Crawford |first=Anthony |date=2023-12-19 |title=2024 BYD Seal review |url=https://www.carexpert.com.au/car-reviews/2024-byd-seal-review |access-date=2023-12-20 |website=CarExpert |language=en}}</ref>

The Seal is available with a rotatable 15.6-inch [[In-car entertainment|infotainment]] screen, 10.25-inch digital instrument panel, 12-speaker [[Dynaudio]] audio system, panoramic sunroof, quilted [[vegan leather]] upholstery, dual wireless smartphone chargers and heated and ventilated front seats. The Seal also has a 53-litre front trunk ([[frunk]]).<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Ingram |first=Richard |date=2023-11-16 |title=New BYD Seal 2023 review: a high quality EV that's great to drive |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/byd/seal |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=Auto Express |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=BYD Seal to go on sale in UK: New electric saloon with 354-mile range |url=https://www.carmagazine.co.uk/car-news/first-official-pictures/byd/seal-ev/ |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=CAR Magazine |language=en}}</ref> Some models are equipped with Intelligent Torque Adaption Control (iTAC) system (a [[torque vectoring]] system) and adaptive dampers.<ref name=":1" />

<gallery widths="220" heights="150">
File:BYD Seal IAA 2023 1X7A0505.jpg|Rear view
File:The interior of BYD SEAL.jpg|Interior
</gallery>

== Powertrain ==
The Seal is equipped with either a 61.4 kWh or an 82.5 kWh [[lithium iron phosphate battery|LFP]] [[blade battery pack]], which can be charged by a 220 [[volt|V]] [[alternating current|AC]] power source at 7 kW (11 kW in Europe),<ref name="11kw" /> or a [[direct current|DC]] [[fast charger]] at 110 or 150 kW (depending on the model). BYD claimed a domestic [[all-electric range|driving range]] between {{convert|550|and|700|km}}.<ref>{{Cite web |date=7 September 2022 |title=When the BYD Atto 3 Standard Range, Seal, Dolphin will hit Australia |url=https://www.carexpert.com.au/car-news/when-the-byd-atto-3-standard-range-seal-dolphin-will-hit-australia |access-date=30 March 2022 |website=carexpert.com.au |language=en}}</ref> The battery pack reportedly can be fast charged from 30%-80% in 30 minutes, and the car has vehicle-to-load capability.<ref name=":0" />

The Seal's top speed is limited to {{convert|180|km/h}},<ref>{{Cite web |date=14 March 2022 |title=BYD Seal, Geometry E, and more announced NEVs from China – March 2022 (Part 1) |url=https://carnewschina.com/2022/03/14/byd-seal-geometry-e-and-more-announced-nevs-from-china-march-2022-part-1/ |access-date=29 March 2022 |website=CarNewsChina.com |language=en-US}}</ref> and the [[0 to 60 mph|0–100 km/h]] acceleration is claimed to be around 7.5 seconds for the standard models and 3.8 seconds for its AWD Performance model.<ref name=":0" /> BYD claims the Seal AWD energy consumption is 12.7 kWh/100 km.<ref name=":2" />

== Markets ==

=== China ===
The Seal went on sale in China in July 2022, with deliveries in the following month.<ref>{{Cite web |title=China: BYD Seal Enters The Market With Over 60,000 Pre-Orders |url=https://insideevs.com/news/601426/china-byd-seal-launch-60000-preorders/ |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}}</ref>  There were four models of [[powertrain]]s offered in China, starting with a standard "Elite" model (精英型) powered by a {{convert|150|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} single-[[electric motor|motor]] [[rear wheel drive]] (RWD), "Prestige" model (尊贵型) produces {{cvt|170|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} with single-motor RWD, "Performance" model (性能型) powered by a {{convert|230|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} single-motor RWD, and the "4WD Performance" model (四驱性能型) with the {{convert|390|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} dual-motor ({{convert|160|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} + {{convert|230|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}}) [[all wheel drive]].

In May 2023, BYD introduced the Seal Champion Edition in China. The version introduces lower pricing,<ref>{{Cite web |last=McDee |first=Max |date=2023-05-10 |title=Refreshed BYD Seal goes on sale with lower prices |url=https://www.arenaev.com/refreshed_byd_seal_goes_on_sale_with_lower_prices-news-1794.php |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=ArenaEV.com |language=en-US}}</ref> with adjusted and upgraded equipment list such as leather seats, rear privacy glass, an adjustable cup holder in the armrest box. It also received an additional "700 km Prestige" grade level with {{convert|700|km||}} of range.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Pandaily |date=2023-05-10 |title=BYD Seal Champion Edition Releases with A New 700km Luxury Version |url=https://pandaily.com/byd-seal-champion-edition-releases-with-a-new-700km-luxury-version/ |access-date=2023-11-12 |website=Pandaily |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Europe ===
The Seal became available in several European countries in September 2023, occupying the [[D-segment]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bobylev |first=Denis |date=2023-09-04 |title=BYD Seal to start deliveries in Europe in November for 44,900 EUR. The Seal U and Denza D9 will follow |url=https://carnewschina.com/2023/09/04/byd-seal-to-start-deliveries-in-europe-in-november-for-44900-eur-the-seal-u-and-denza-d9-will-follow/ |access-date=2023-12-15 |website=CarNewsChina.com |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Southeast Asia ===
The Seal went on sale in Thailand and Singapore in September 2023. In both countries, available grades are Dynamic RWD, Premium RWD and Performance AWD. The former is equipped with a 61.4 kWh [[Lithium iron phosphate battery|LFP]] [[Blade battery]] which powers a single {{convert|150|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} rear motor. The Premium RWD uses a larger 82.5 kWh LFP battery, powering a single {{convert|230|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}} rear motor. The Performance AWD (badged '3.8s' denoting the {{convert|0-100|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}} [[acceleration]] time of 3.8 seconds) uses a dual-motor setup with a maximum output of {{convert|390|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}}, with the same 82.5 kWh LFP battery.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Chan |first=Mick |date=2023-10-02 |title=2023 BYD Seal EV launched in Thailand (from RM170k) and Singapore (from RM834k) - Malaysia soon? |url=https://paultan.org/2023/10/02/byd-seal-launched-in-thailand-and-singapore-from-rm169k-for-204-hp-61-4-kwh-base-variant-in-thailand/ |access-date=2023-12-15 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-10-02 |title=BYD Seal electric sedan launched in Thailand: Costs as much as MG ZS EV |work=The Times of India |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/auto/cars/byd-seal-electric-sedan-launched-in-thailand-costs-as-much-as-mg-zs-ev/articleshow/104107031.cms?from=mdr |access-date=2023-12-15 |issn=0971-8257}}</ref>

The Seal was introduced in Indonesia in January 2024 alongside the [[BYD Atto 3|Atto 3]] and [[BYD Dolphin|Dolphin]], as part of BYD's entry to the Indonesian passenger car market.<ref>{{Cite web  |date=2024-01-18 |title=China's BYD introduces 3 EV models in Indonesia |url=https://english.news.cn/20240118/88f011cc37aa4aeebe6ccfdc4cc3bb25/c.html |access-date=2024-03-15 |website=Xinhua}}</ref> Sales price were announced at the [[Indonesia International Motor Show#2024|31st Indonesia International Motor Show]] in February 2024.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Widya |first=Arianti |date=2024-02-15 |title=BYD Reveals Prices of Three Electric Vehicles at IIMS Exhibition|url=https://www.viva.co.id/english/1689518-byd-reveals-prices-of-three-electric-vehicles-at-iims-exhibition |access-date=2024-03-15 |website=viva.co.id}}</ref>

The Seal was introduced in Malaysia in February 2024, it is available in 2 grades, which are Premium RWD and Performance AWD.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lim |first=Anthony |date=2024-02-22 |title=BYD Seal EV launched in Malaysia – two variants, up to 523 hp/670 Nm, 570 km range; from RM179,800 - paultan.org |url=https://paultan.org/2024/02/22/byd-seal-ev-launched-in-malaysia/ |access-date=2024-03-30 |website=Paul Tan's Automotive News |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Australia ===
The Seal went on sale in Australia in October 2023. Available grades matches Thai and Singaporean market Seal, which are Dynamic RWD, Premium RWD and Performance AWD.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Misoyannis |first=Alex |date=2023-10-17 |title=2024 BYD Seal price and specs: Tesla Model 3 rival starts from about $51,000 drive-away |url=https://www.drive.com.au/news/2024-byd-seal-price-and-specs/ |access-date=2023-12-19 |website=Drive |language=en-AU}}</ref>

=== Brazil ===
The Seal went on sale in Brazil in August 2023. The only variant available is the dual-motor AWD version with an output of {{convert|390|kW|PS hp|0|abbr=on}}.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bobylev |first=Denis |date=2023-08-31 |title=BYD Seal EV launched in Brazil for 60,685 USD as BYD accelerates its overseas expansion |url=https://carnewschina.com/2023/08/31/byd-seal-ev-launched-in-brazil-for-60685-usd-as-byd-accelerates-its-overseas-expansion/ |access-date=2023-12-15 |website=CarNewsChina.com |language=en-US}}</ref>{{clear}}
